subject: Re: [junit] Logging tests reports
msgSnippet: I don t think so. If you are talking about running the textui, you can capture it s stdout and stderr on the commandline.  Any other ui simply displays the
messageBody:
I don't think so.

If you are talking about running the textui, you can capture it's stdout and
stderr on the commandline. Any other ui simply displays the results in the
GUI.

i.e.

java -classpath $CLASSPATH $options junit.textui.TestRunner $test $log 2>&1

=jason
--- Luis Joaquim <ljoaquim@...> wrote:
> Hello,
>
> I am just starting to "discover" JUnit, and I have a begginer's
> question:
>
> Doesn't JUnit keeps the log of executing tests in a file ?
>
> Like, how many tests passed, which one failed, ..., and so on?
>
> If yes, where ?
>
> Thanks in advance,
>
> Luis Joaquim
>
>
